rev.comment: Removed tail end "it amounts to the [[rape]] of a dead person". See talk page
rev.diff:
Line 12: Line 12:
== Consensuality issue ==
== Consensuality issue ==
â
A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive, it amounts to the [[rape]] of a dead person. Virtually all human [[society|societies]] condemn abuse of the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect. In rare cases, however, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him.
+
A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive. Virtually all human [[society|societies]] condemn abuse of the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect. In rare cases, however, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him.
== Necrophilia in neo-psychoanalysis ==
== Necrophilia in neo-psychoanalysis ==
